intro: Tritonia deusta subsp. deusta, commonly known as the Spanish bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, violet, or white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Tritonia deusta subsp. deusta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
